result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating While under Influence (5th or 6th) and Operating with PAC of .02 or More (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating While under Influence (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating with PAC of .02 or More (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael L Krohn was found guilty of Operating While under Influence (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as the conditional or probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $600.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees. $1,000.00 has been applied towards the defendant's fines/costs.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
---------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDRED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------

Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan
-----------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
-----------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge, unless previously provided.
-------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence forthwith - NO work release privileges until Monday, July 26, 2010 at which time the defendant may have work release Monday through Friday, BUT not more than eight (8) hours a day.
